Stage 01: Minimising volume of air that needs to be moved (with consideration to wellbeing) including fan power consumption and use of natural ventilation
Stage 02: Mixed mode ventilation with smart controls to minimise reliance on mechanical ventilation (may also provide cooling benfit)
Stage 03: Lowe SFP local MVHR units with high efficiency heat recovery and demand driven controls interfaced with natural ventilation
Stage 04: Extract Only ventilation combined with fresh air supply ventialtion incorporating local heating & cooling

Stage 01 - Automated Meter Reading (AMR) with sub-metering for specific sub-areas/equipment; includign integration with BMA
Stage 02 - Energy Management System (EMS) connected to BMS with data logging aids

Stage 03 - Interactive tools tracking energy consumption in real-time allowing for immediate adjustments to reduce waste with BMA using optimisation algorithms to automatically adjust settings for optimal energy efficiency
Stage 04 - Use of real time data analysis and forecasting reduces energy use by anticipating demand and adjusting operations to reduce energy waste
Stage 01 - Manual Fault Detection
Stage 02 - Simple fault detection and automated notifications/ alerts
Stage 03 - Data driven automatic fault monitoring providng detialed insights and analytics to support decision-making
Stage 04 - Proactive fault detection and automatic resolution predicting when equipment is likley to fail or require maintenance.

Stage 05 - Comfortable indoor environment temperatures using the adaptive thermal comfort model  without the requirements for active cooling

Review local planning requirements for minimum analysis and thresholds for wind-speed etc. – ensure that the project is compliant. E.g. in the City of London microclimate requirement; Hong Kong, LEED, BREEAM and DGNB-requirements regarding microclimate assessment levels.
If there are no specific planning requirements, provide a desktop study of prevailing local conditions.

Screening level wind study using CFD or wind tunnel for min. 12 directions: analysis of potential wind speed-up issues and highlight of any stagnant area where AQ or outdoor thermal comfort might be a concern (in particular for regions where local wind speeds are in average really low, like far east).
Simplified outdoor thermal comfort assessment based on local climate: identify the need of mitigation strategies for each season, for example shading or wind protection

Assessing Pedestrian level Wind comfort and safety involving CFD or wind tunnel using min. 16 wind directions to comply with DGNB wind requirement of potential problems on site Compare existing scenario with proposed scenario to identify potential wind acceleration issues or stagnant areas
Identify the need for urban furniture and wind mitigation measures to improve local microclimate condition so that wind any uncomfortable or unsafe conditions on site are controlled and minimized.
Run a seasonal solar exposure analysis to identify the areas fulfilling the thermal comfort suggested strategies outlined in level 2.

Conduct wind comfort assessment with vegetation and mitigation option included (min 16 wind directions) DGNB+ on microclimate as level 3 plus testing the mitigation steps on site – follow-up after handover and measuring the efficiency of the measures.
Outdoor thermal comfort detailed analysis predicting hourly felt temperature values for the final design during the most critical parts of the year.

Conduct outdoor thermal and wind comfort assessment including air quality assessment, if relevant, for achieving best DGNB ratings. Including assessment of potential extreme heat and wind events for evaluating level of mitigation requirement with testing.
Open for sharing data, challenges and learnings with academia/global construction industry and publication of assessment and outcome of design to enhanced market exposure.

Interventions: Material Specification to prevent harm to occupants
Intervention Description: Reduce potential for slipping, sharp edges, breaking.

Interventions: User experience evaluation to assess occupant comfort
Intervention Description: Implement user experience evaluation to assess comfort related needs in the design phase, helping to eliminate discomfort disorders (e.g. work-related musculoskeletal issues)
Burglary preventive measures/ surveillance of openings accessible from terrain

Interventions: Hazard Reviews to eliminate or mitigate danagers

Intervention Description: Take measures for reduction of hazards in daily operation
Provide technical safety equipment like fire detection and alarm systems, increasing the response capacity and users' feelings of safety, while discouraging potential offenders

Interventions: Eliminate blind corners, confined spaces and hiding places
Intervention Description: Eliminate blind corners, confined spaces and hiding places
Limit volume and speed of traffic within the building site by incorporating safe pedestrian, non-motorized transport, and delimited recreational facilities/play areas away from access roads
Use Integrated Pest Management (IPM) concepts and requirements into facility design and construction for both interior, landscape and grass pest

Interventions: Upgrade the physical security using classified building parts RC(Resistance Class)
Intervention Description: Upgrade the physical security using classified building parts RC (Resistance Class)

Incorporate continuous commissioning into the building maintenance program and safety & security plan, to ensure that possible optimization gets in focus for the benefit of the staff, customers and economic bottom-line.
Monitor chemical inventories of products, systems and materials used in the operation and maintenance, to identify opportunities to substitute them with green products

Protect the building with landscape art (e.g. barriers with artful perforations) and/or incorporate secondary building structures (e.g. in a building annex), where active security screenings can take place preventing potential attackers from entering the primary building.
Safe, aesthetically designed and accessible stairs and ramps, servicing all floors
Encourage the use of stairs and guide users to the stairs, bicycle racks or storage
Multipurpose rooms and changing facilities
Safe Cycling and Pedestrians Network
Exercise mat or equipment in room with pre-loaded stretching or training workouts.
Rewards linked to 'steps'.
Enhanced Stairs with High Quality design
Specification of lower flow toilets, taps and showerheads
Install efficient appliances(washing machines/dishwasher)
Signposting to reduce consumption
Encouraging behavioural changes

Compliant Monitoring & Leak detection at main meter + sub metering for uses above 10% demand

Stage 02 - Smart meters with AMI for detailed consumption feedback
i.e '70% of your potable water is recycled'
Stage 03 - AMI system for comprehensive data analysis and feedback
Rainwater tank to collect water
Install a programmed automatic, in-ground irrigation/sprinkler system with a weather-based SMART irrigation controller, including a rain sensor.

Interventions: Creating sustainable water-efficient landscape at community level
Intervention Description: Transformation of the current landscape into a sustainable, water-efficient landscape for rainwater harvesting at a community level.

Interventions: Utilising non-mains water for landscapre irrigation
Intervention Description: Solely using municipal and/or on-site/in-house reclaimed water for all outdoor water use related to garden and landscape irrigation.

Stage 01 - Provide a simple assessment to identify opportunites within one selected area/theme
Decide to engage in simple circular system, e.g consider reuse of materials through existing channels

Stage 02 - Provide a simple assessment to identify opportunities within multiple areas/themes
Decide to embed more readily available circular solutions into the building
Stage 03 - Provide a thorough assessment to identify mulitiple circular opportunites and potential challenges or risks that are relevant for the project
Stage 04 - Very thorough assessment carried out to create full picture of opportunites and challenges for circularity as well as solutions.
Detailed evaluation of potential environmental impacts/benefits
Testing of new circular solutions in the project
Strategic target to create a fully circular building, data driven and designed for disassembly
Notification to neighbours in terms of scope and measures to prevent noise, dust etc.
Undertaking environmental appraisal
Stage 01 - Preliminary feasibility study on the potentials of reuse in the existing building is conducted. (screening)
Stage 02 - Preliminary pre-demolition audit on the potentials of reuse in the existing building is conducted
Stage 03 - More in-depth mapping and examination of materials and components is conducted including calcualtion on savings on emission and costs.

Stage 04 - Mapping of materials and buildings components is supplemented with a suitability analysis, examining if some of the identified buildings components can be reused in the design 1 to 1 or fulfilling a secondary function.

Providing applicable LCA and LCC data, as well as qualitative data to the dismounted materials and buildings components. The materials are thereby prepared for online databases, markets, entering other LCA or LCC calculations etc
The reused building components will be supported by a static documentation, evaluating on the load capacity and estimated lifetime
Identify potentially harmful products e.g. glues and propose non-hazardous solutions.Collation of product data sheets.

Interventions: Exclusion of identified hazardous materials from specification
Intervention Description: Stage 01 - Develop materials specification to exclude a significant proportion of identified hazardous substances.

Interventions: Exclusion of identified hazardous materials from specification
Intervention Description: Stage 02 - Develop materials specification to exclude all identified hazardous substances.

Interventions: Building Management to exclude use of specific substances
Intervention Description: Building Management operations to implement a policy for exclusion of specific substances for product repairs and replacement, as well as for maintenance and cleaning products.
Stage 01 - review of best available data on climate hazard mapping and risk assessment is conducted.
Stage 02 - Application of best available data to perform a high-level site-specific climate hazard mapping and risk assessment for current climate.

Stage 03 - Application of best available data to perform a community-, city- or catchment-wide climate hazard mapping and risk assessment for current and future climate, including evaluation of the socio-economic components of risk beyond the site boundary or asset scale.
Stage 0 1- Security Consultant to undertake a site specific security risk assessment & propose a security strategy
Stage 02 - Risk assessment to identify all levels of risk, threat and systems redundancies.
Stage 03 - Implementation of a security strategy which outlines a plan for varying security threat scenarios and system failures
Stage 0 1 - Internal secure zones for different building user types
Stage 02 - Measures to prevent tailgating i.e security personnel, secure/biometric access

Intervention Description: Stage 0 1- Additional CCTV in public spaces

Interventions: Implementation of physical security measures - CCTV
Intervention Description: Stage 02 - Comprehensive CCTV strategy with CCTV analytics to identify suspicious behaviour
Undertake appropriate consultation with each stakeholder group to get opinion and feedback from all stakeholders with the aim of incorporating feedback into the design.
Identify multiple functionalities and facilities e.g. community use of rooms, public spaces to be used for events to maximise the space utilisation of appropriate areas within the building.

stage 01 - Post Occupancy Evaluation after the first 12 months to gain occupant feedback.
Life Cycle Cost analysis into value added for the client and the local community.

Stage 02 - Coordination of Post Occupancy Evaluation data and building performance data and lessons learned feedback – make changes to the design.
Continuous evolution of the brief.
Appointment of ecologist to provide advice
Stage 01 - Create a specific biodiversity action plan for the site/area.
Stage 02 - Create a specific biodiversity action plan for the site/area, using only indigenous species.
Create natural habitats like ponds and breeding/resting habitat for valuable or threatened species.
Combine systems for local management of open stormwater and green areas (blue and green infrastructure) and ensure an active nature management plan in operational phase.
